title: Finding Exponential Models Given No Points of Form (0,a)
text: We can still find an exponential formula with two points that are not in the form (0,a). First, subsitute both points into two equations with the form $$f(x)={a\left(b\right)}^x$$. Solve the resulting system of two equations in two unknowns to find a and $$b$$.

title: Using the First Data Point
text: Plugging in the first data point, we get $$1={a\left(b\right)}^3$$.

title: Using the Second Data Point
text: Plugging in the second data point, we get $$4={a\left(b\right)}^5$$.

title: Solving the System of Equations
text: Then, by solving for a in the first equation, we get $$a=\frac{1}{b^3}$$. Next, subsitute this value for a in the second equation to solve for $$b$$. We get $$4=\frac{1}{b^3} b^5$$, which simplifies to $$4=b^2$$. Solve for $$b$$, and then use the numerical value of $$b$$ to find the numerical value of a.
